channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump vs. Harris Economic Plans: Taxes, Affordable Housing, and Inflation
item.description: How will the Trump and Harris economic plans affect your investing? One candidate is looking to increase affordable housing and give homebuyers a break on their first property. The other […]

item.title: Sonos delays set-top box after flawed app update
item.description: It’s been an infamous year for software updates gone wrong. But what’s the worst-case scenario for a buggy update? Sonos may be trying to find the answer as its mobile app update continues to derail its best laid plans. In its most recent earnings call, the company announced that it had no choice but to […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: She Ate a Poppy Seed Salad Just Before Giving Birth. Then They Took Her Baby Away.
item.description: Hospitals use drug tests that return false positives from poppy seed bagels, decongestants and Zantac. Yet newborns are being taken from parents based on the results.

item.title: The “Creative” Framework for Low-Down, High-Return Rentals
item.description: Are high interest rates and large down payments stopping you from investing in real estate? If so, creative finance might be precisely what you need. It’s what today’s guest, Ankit […]

item.title: EV startup Ather seeks to raise $370 million in India IPO
item.description: Indian electric scooter manufacturer Ather Energy plans to raise about $370 million in an IPO. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: The Seemingly Endless Cycle of Reforms in Juvenile Justice
item.description: As Ohio considers closing youth detention facilities, recent efforts in other states have hit roadblocks.

item.title: Reaching Financial Independence with 5 Properties & Multiple Income Streams
item.description: Can real estate investing still propel you to financial independence in 2024? Despite starting with very little money or know-how, this investor found creative ways to build a real estate […]

item.title: Electro-hydraulic muscles help these robot legs stand straight on uneven terrain
item.description: Along with the ability to automatically adjust to the surface they’re traversing, the legs move faster and jump higher than their more standardized electric counterparts. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: You’re About to Deliver Your Baby. This Faulty Drug Test Could Take Your Newborn Away.
item.description: Listen to our investigation into how hospitals use unreliable test results to report parents to child welfare agencies.

item.title: A Look at How Much Evictions Really Cost You as a Landlord
item.description: We know evictions can be costly for both landlords and tenants (both financially and sometimes emotionally). But recently, I heard two investors discussing who actually loses more during the process. […]

item.title: European VC Atomico closes $1.24B across two funds for early and growth-stage startups
item.description: Atomico has historically leaned toward earlier funding rounds while dipping into later stages where it made sense; now it's setting itself up to focus just as much on the later stages of a startup's journey. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: A Serious Case of Prison Visit Blues
item.description: Tariq MaQbool reflects on disruptive COVID-era visitation restrictions that remain in effect at New Jersey State Prison.

item.title: Is a National Construction Boom on the Way? Here’s How 2025’s Market Might Look
item.description: Don’t pop the champagne just yet, but one major economist just stated that he envisions the federal funds rate dropping to 3.25% once the Federal Reserve’s rate-cutting cycle is over. […]

item.title: The Try Guys say their subscription strategy is working
item.description: YouTube creators The Try Guys claim they’re on-track to reach profitability, with subscriptions to their three-month-old, ad-free service 2nd Try now accounting for 20% of the company’s revenue. Those numbers mean The Try Guys, known for testing out different experiences, remain reliant on other revenue streams, including YouTube advertising. But in an interview with CNBC, […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: How Efforts to Cut Long Prison Sentences Have Stalled
item.description: Crime victim advocates and conservative groups are resisting moves to revisit “truth-in-sentencing” laws.
